title: Headrest
text: Like the larger stools, Luba headrests with female figures are symbolically powerful objects associated with chiefs.  The two figures represent Luba matrilineal ancestors who are the literal and figurative support of the hereditary chiefs.  The embracing women also reference the importance of family unity and continuity.
description: two female figures facing each other and embracing; string of red beads around feet of one figure and around neck of the other
